workflow.name: Personalized hotel reward emails for high-spenders with Salesforce, Gemini AI & Brevo
workflow.description:
This n8n workflow automatically detects high‚Äëspending hotel guests after checkout and emails them a personalized, one‚Äëtime reward offer.

---

### **üîß What it does**
- Watches Salesforce `Guest__c` custom object for checkout updates.
- Pulls guest spend data on optional paid amenities:
  - Room Service
  - Minibar
  - Laundry
  - Late Checkout
  - Extra Bed
  - Airport Transfer
- Calculates total spend to identify VIP guests (‚â• **$50**).
- Uses AI to:
  - Spot unused services.
  - Randomly pick one unused service.
  - Generate a realistic, short promo like:  
    _"Free late checkout on your next stay"_
- Parses AI output into JSON.
- Sends a polished HTML email to the guest with their personalized offer.

---

### **üì¶ Key nodes**
- `Salesforce Trigger` ‚Üí monitors new checkouts.
- `Salesforce` ‚Üí fetches detailed spend data.
- `Function` ‚Üí sums up total amenity spend.
- `IF` ‚Üí filters for VIP guests.
- `LangChain LLM` + `Google Vertex AI` ‚Üí drafts the offer text.
- `Structured Output Parser` ‚Üí cleans AI output.
- `Brevo` ‚Üí delivers branded email.

---

### **üìä Example output**
> _Subject:_ `John, We Have Something Special for Your Next Stay`  
> _Offer in email:_ `Enjoy a complimentary minibar selection on your next stay.`

---

### **‚ú® Why it matters**
Rewarding guests who already spend boosts loyalty and repeat bookings ‚Äî without generic discounts. The offer feels personal, relevant, and exclusive.

parameters.subject: ={{ $('Check the threshold exceedings').item.json.Name }}, We Have Something Special for Your Next Stay
parameters.htmlContent:
= Exclusive Offer Just for You
A Special Thank You

We're delighted to share an exclusive offer with you:

{{ $json.output.suggested_offer }}

We look forward to welcoming you again soon!

parameters.content:
## üì© **High-Spender Guest Reward Automation**

This workflow automatically detects high‚Äëspending guests after checkout and sends them a personalized reward offer by email...

---

### **üîß What it does**
- Listens for updates on the `Guest__c` custom object in Salesforce.
- Fetches guests‚Äô spend across optional paid amenities:
  - Room Service
  - Minibar
  - Laundry
  - Late Checkout
  - Extra Bed
  - Airport Transfer
- Calculates total spend to find VIP guests (threshold ‚â• **$50**).
- Uses an AI agent to:
  - Spot which services the guest hasn‚Äôt used yet.
  - Randomly pick one unused service to offer as a free perk.
  - Generate a realistic, short promotional text.
- Parses the AI output.
- Sends a branded HTML email to the guest with the customized offer.

---

### **üì¶ Key nodes**
- `Salesforce Trigger` ‚Üí watches for checkout updates.
- `Salesforce` ‚Üí pulls guest spend details.
- `Function` ‚Üí computes total amenity spend.
- `IF` ‚Üí filters guests who spent over the threshold.
- `LangChain LLM + Google Vertex AI` ‚Üí drafts the offer text.
- `Structured Output Parser` ‚Üí extracts clean JSON.
- `Brevo` ‚Üí delivers the email.

---

### **üìä Example output**
> _Subject:_ `John, We Have Something Special for Your Next Stay`  
> _Offer in email:_ `Enjoy a complimentary minibar selection on your next stay.`

---

### **‚ú® Why**
Rewarding guests *who already show willingness to spend* increases loyalty and repeat bookings ‚Äî without blanket discounts. The offer feels personal, relevant, and exclusive.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
